name: A Systematic Study of the Majjhima Nikaya
description: Lectures on the life of the Buddha, ethics, meditation, and wisdom.

name: An Introduction to Buddhism
description: Bhikkhu Pesala provides an overview of the Noble Eightfold Path and several meditation techniques in plain language.

description: Author of several books and papers on Theravada topics.

name: Allowing Things to Arise

description: The four different kinds of attachment and how to eliminate the causes of those attachments.

name: Letting Go

description: Monk with roots in the Sri Lanka and Myanmar Forest Traditions.

description: Web budista dedicada al Canon Pali, el budismo temprano, y la Tradición de Ajahn Chah.

name: Dhamma Musings
description: Shravasti Dhammika's musings and travels.

description: Lay disciple's insights in practicing the early Buddhist teachings.

description: Making the authentic teachings of the Buddha accessible to the modern world through textual analysis.

description: Opinions on Buddhism and related issues in a contemporary context.

description: Personal blog of an experienced Buddhist monk.

name: How to Meditate
description: Guide on how to meditate, available in various formats and languages.

name: Lessons in Practical Buddhism
description: Practical teachings to help people live in peace and happiness.

description: Single volume containing many of Ajahn Chah's talks that convey the teachings in a direct, simple, yet profound manner.

name: The Four Noble Truths

name: BuddhaNet
description: Sample of talks from teachers of several traditions, both lay and ordained.

description: Talks from the BSWA organized by teacher and category.

description: Recorded talks from Tisarana Buddhist Monastery in Canada.

description: Forums for SuttaCentral early Buddhist texts.

name: Dhamma Wheel

description: Ask and learn from the members of Dhammaloka City Centre in Australia.

name: Forest Sangha
description: Home of the international monasteries in the Thai Forest Tradition of Ajahn Chah.

description: Practice declensions, conjugations, and vocabulary.

name: Pronunciation
description: Single page guide on the Pali alphabet and its pronunciation.

name: Bhikkhu Bodhi's A Course in the Pali Language
description: Designed to help you to learn the basics of Pali grammar and vocabulary through direct study of selections from the Buddha’s discourses. It aims to enable you to read the Buddha’s discourses in the original as quickly as possible.

name: Buddha Vacana
description: This website is dedicated to those who wish to understand better the words of the Buddha by learning the basics of Pali language, but who don't have much time available for it.

name: Pali Suffixes
description: List of the different ways words can end, from the Pali Dictionary by Kogen Mizuno.

name: Basic Pāli Noun Declension (PDF)
description: Cheatsheet with the various forms that nouns can take.

name: Pali Verbal Endings (PDF)
description: Cheatsheet with verbal endings based on tense.

name: Morphological analyzer and generator for Pali (PDF)
description: First step in the direction of the morphological analysis of Pali.

name: Chant Pali
description: Helpful guides for chanting and learning the most common Pali phrases, broken down line-by-line and syllable-by-syllable.

name: Pratyeka
description: Comprehensive study of Pali through three textbooks.

name: Abhayagiri
description: Redwood Valley, California - Environment in which individuals and families are given the opportunity to be in contact with the principles of the Buddha's teachings.

name: Amaravati

name: Aruna Ratanagiri

name: Cittaviveka
description: Hampshire, England - Primarily a residence for monks and nuns.

name: Dhamma Vihara
description: Veracruz, Mexico - Facilitates group and individual meditation retreats.

name: Dhammapala

name: Temple Forest Monastery
description: Temple, New Hampshire - Balance of wilderness, seclusion, and accessibility.

description: Warwickshire, England - Headquarters of the Buddhist Prison Chaplaincy Organisation.

description: Barre, Massachusetts - Offers residential and online courses combining study, discussion, and meditation.

name: Dhamma.ru
description: A variety of resources.

name: Theravada.ru
description: An introduction to Theravada Buddhism from the St. Petersburg community.

description: The Buddha's first discourse.

name: Dhammapada

description: Read and compare multiple versions of the Dhammapada side-by-side.

name: Sādhu!

description: Dhamma talks by various monastics, including Ajahn Brahm.
